title: Israel-Hamas war: IDF says forces operating 'in the heart of Gaza City'
description: One month after Hamas' bloody October 7 attacks, Defense Minister Yoav Gallant said Tuesday that Israel's military is fighting in the 'depths' of Gaza City after encircling the northern part of the besieged Palestinian enclave.

title: Champions League: AC Milan get crucial win over PSG
description: Frenchman Olivier Giroud scored the decisive goal for the Italian side as they picked up a pivotal 2-1 win over Paris Saint-Germain at the San Siro to stay alive in Group F.

title: Stars of David graffiti in Paris: Russian interference suspected
description: French intelligence services believe the act was commissioned by the Moldovan businessman Anatolii Prizenko. Images were widely shared by the 'Doppelgänger' pro-Russian propaganda network.

title: Charles III makes first King's Speech with Sunak's last policy plans
description: On Tuesday, Queen Elizabeth II's successor delivered the last King's Speech before the 2024 general elections. Several projects are designed to mobilize the Tory electorate, while going against the recommendations of international bodies on climate issues.

title: 'France's immigration bill, supposed to embody Macron's search for transpartisanship, illustrates his exhaustion'
description: Emmanuel Macron has always sought to reach across party lines. But his government's bill, which is being debated in Parliament, shows that the right-left cleavage is once again shaping national politics, writes Le Monde's Solenn de Royer in her column.

title: With the undocumented migrants whose French healthcare aid may be slashed
description: As France's Parliament debates a bill on immigration that includes provisions to significantly reduce the only healthcare coverage available to undocumented people, care workers worry about the public health consequences of such a move.

title: French Alps launch bid for 2030 Winter Olympics
description: France, which is hosting the Summer Olympics in 2024 and has hosted the Winter Games three times, would spread the competition among sites across the Alps.

title: Quantum computers: French start-up Quandela raises €50 million
description: This funding, which comes less than a year after the $100 million raised by its competitor Pasqal, illustrates the advances made by this technology.

title: Portuguese PM resigns after being named in corruption probe
description: Hours earlier, police arrested Prime Minister António Costa's chief of staff while raiding several public buildings.

title: Israel observes day of mourning to mark one-month anniversary of Hamas attack
description: A minute of silence was marked nationwide at 11am to mark the anniversary of the October 7 shock onslaught by the Hamas terror group, in which over 1,400 people were killed and some 240 were taken hostage.

title: Global wine production hits lowest level since 1961
description: Global output decreased by 7% from last year, the International Organisation of Vine and Wine said.

title: France's new Marianne stamp goes green
description: Every five years, the president selects a new depiction of the feminine national symbol to be used as the country's standard stamp.

title: Palestinian activist Ahed Tamimi arrested by Israeli army in West Bank
description: Arrested in her village of Nabi Salih in the West Bank, the prominent activist has been accused of 'inciting violence and terrorist activities' over a threatening message posted on Instagram. Her family denies she posted it.

title: Germany takes tougher line on immigration
description: Following a conference, the Federal and Länder governments adopted a series of measures designed to stem the flow of undocumented migrants and tighten asylum policy.

title: French Jews feel increasingly isolated: 'There aren't many people to support us'
description: Since the early 2000s, with anti-Semitism on the rise amid general indifference, French Jews have felt abandoned by the government and by society. This anxiety has intensified since the October 7 Hamas attack on Israel.

title: 2023 Goncourt prize awarded to Jean-Baptiste Andrea
description: France's most prestigious literary award recognized Jean-Baptiste Andrea for his novel 'Veiller sur elle' ('Watch Over Her'). Ann Scott won the competing Renaudot award for 'Les insolents' ('The insolent').

title: Israel-Hamas war: Public opinion in North Africa breaks with the West
description: In the streets of Rabat, Algiers and Tunis, anger rumbles against the West's 'unconditional' support for Israel, putting authorities in an awkward position.

title: Europe's Euclid satellite reveals its first images of the cosmos
description: The satellite, whose mission will be to track down dark matter and dark energy, will enter its operational phase in January 2024.

title: Murder of French teacher in Arras sends lasting shockwaves through profession
description: French teachers returned to their classrooms on Monday after a two-week break. The death of their colleague Dominique Bernard, killed by a radicalized former pupil at his school, has left them feeling that they could be targeted for doing their jobs.

title: The Louvre launches public funding campaign for Chardin's 'Le Panier de fraises des bois'
description: The museum raised two-thirds of the sum needed to acquire the painting, thanks almost entirely to LVMH group. It is now counting on a collective surge of generosity to acquire this 'national treasure.'

title: In search of new markets, France is working to establish itself in Uzbekistan
description: Following the French president's November 2 visit, major French groups have made the trip to help exploit the natural resources that Uzbekistan is rich in, as the nation seeks to modernize.

title: Israeli settlers step up defence of their colonies in the West Bank
description: In the Palestinian territories occupied by Israel since 1967, Hamas' October 7 attack came as a shock. Their inhabitants are mobalizing.

title: Turkey's Erdogan is mediator no more in Israel-Hamas war
description: The Turkish president has hardened his stance against Israel after failing to become a mediator in negotiations with Hamas. His strategy may further isolate him and increase tensions with Washington.

title: "Narco Business," an unprecedented video immersion into the heart of the drug cartels
description: For two years, Bertrand Monnet, a French business school professor and specialist in the economics of crime, filmed every stage of the notorious Sinaloa cartel's business model in Mexico exclusively for Le Monde. In this first installment, we take an unprecedented dive into the laboratories behind M30, the fentanyl pill that is causing havoc in the United States.

title: Co-working giant WeWork files for bankruptcy
description: WeWork has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, a stunning fall for the office-sharing company once seen as a Wall Street darling that promised to upend the way people went to work around the world.

title: Netanyahu says Israel will take over responsibility of Gaza's security after the war
description: In an interview on Monday, the Israeli prime minister added that despite growing calls for a ceasefire, he does not support the idea without the release of hostages.

title: 'Made in France' products hit hard by inflation
description: Households facing budget restraints are now opting for cheaper products that may be imported. In response to this, French brands are trying to fight back.

title: Andalusia: Environmental treasure of Doñana threatened by drought and illegal wells
description: Doñana National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is losing its lagoons, marshes and migratory bird habitats due to intensive fruit farming and climate change.
